name: v0.2.0
body:
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/compare/v0.1.2...v0.2.0

## New Features

* Graduated VI from experimental ([#1609](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1609))
    * Added `ADVI` and `MAP` inference as support for variational inference methods
* Graduated NNC from experimental ([#1618](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1618))
    * Allows the use of Functorch’s AOT compiler by default for HMC and NUTS
    *  If working with a non-static model or unexpected errors are encountered, you may need to manually disable the `nnc_compile` flag.

## Changes

* `VerboseLevel` in `infer` is deprecated. Users should use the new boolean argument `show_progress_bar` to control whether the tqdm progress bar is displayed or not ( [#1603](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1603)).

##  Fixes

* HMC/ NUTS throws an exception when the step size becomes zero ([#1606](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1606))
* Random variables warn users against using torch tensors as arguments ([#1639](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1639))

## Documentations

* Added VI static documentation ([#1613](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1613))
* Added NNC static documentation ([#1619](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1619))
* Added VI PPCA tutorial ([#1617](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1617))
* Added VI tutorial demonstrating ADVI against Gaussian (perfect) and Gamma (approximation gap) targets ([#1621](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1621))
* Added VI tutorial replicating the Tensorflow probability GLMM tutorial ([#1622](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1622))
* Addded VI tutorial demonstrating MAP on Bayesian linear regression and how it coincides with Tikhonov regularization (with Gaussian prior) and LASSO (with Laplace prior) ([#1623](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1623))

name: v0.1.2
body:
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/compare/v0.1.1...v0.1.2

## New Features

* Supports accelerated inference on HMC and NUTS with [functorch](https://github.com/pytorch/functorch)’s Neural Network Compiler (NNC), which can be controlled setting `nnc_compile`  flag when initializing an inference method ([#1385](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1385)) ([Docs](https://beanmachine.org/docs/no_u_turn_sampler/#usage)) 
* Supports parallel sampling when number of chains > 1, which can be controlled by setting `run_in_parallel` flag when calling `infer` ([#1369](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1369)) 
* Added progress bar to `BMGInference` ([#1321](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1321))
* `MonteCarloSamples` object returned from an inference will contain log likelihood and observations now ([#1269](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1269))
* Reworked `bm.simulate`, which accepts a dictionary of posterior as inputs as well ([#1474](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1474))
* Binary wheels for M1 Apple Silicon and Python 3.10 are included in the release ([#1419](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1419), [#1507](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1507))


## Changes

* The default number of adaptive samples will be algorithm-specific now. For most of the algorithms, the default number of adaptive samples is still 0. For HMC and NUTS, the default is changed to half of number of samples (i.e. `num_samples // 2` ) ([#1353](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1353))
* In `CompositionalInference`, the default algorithm for continuous latent variables is changed to NUTS (`GlobalNoUTurnSampler`) ([#1407](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1407)).

##  Fixes

* Resolved deprecation warnings to support PyTorch 1.11 ([#1378](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1378)) (Note: PyTorch 1.12 is also supported now)

## Documentations

* Added a Bayesian structural time series tutorial ([#1376](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1376)) ([link to tutorial](https://beanmachine.org/docs/overview/tutorials/Bayesian_Structural_Time_Series/BayesianStructuralTimeSeries/))
* Used the experimental NNC compile feature in supported tutorials ([#1408](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1408))
* Added MiniBM, a minimal and standalone implementation of Bean Machine in around a hundred lines of code (excluding comments) ([#1415](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/pull/1415)) ([minibm.py](https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/blob/main/src/beanmachine/minibm.py))

name: v0.1.1
body:
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/compare/v0.1.0...v0.1.1

## Highlights
- Bean Machine now supports Python 3.9 (#1302)
- Adds the missing cpp header files to the source distribution in PyPI (#1309)
- In case of invalid initialization, BM will attempt to re-initialize an inference and throw a `ValueError` if the model is misspecified (#1313)

name: v0.1.0.post1
body:
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/facebookresearch/beanmachine/compare/v0.1.0...v0.1.0.post1

## Highlights

- Fixed the order of samples returning from `MonteCarloSamples.get_variables` (#1253)
